intro: Homollea, commonly known as the sweet sarsaparilla, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its upright, herbaceous stems and heart-shaped leaves. Homollea species produce small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has historical uses in traditional medicine.
